content.title: Industrial R&D Promotion Programme: Recognition Of In-House R&D Units
content.details: The Department of Scientific & Industrial Research (DSIR) is operating a scheme called 'Recognition of In-House R&D Units' with the objective of granting recognition & registration to in-house R&D units established by the corporate industry. The In-house R&D units are expected to be engaged in innovative research & development activities related to the line of business of the firm, such as the development of new technologies, design & engineering, process/product/design improvements, development new methods of analysis & testing; research for increased efficiency in the use of resources, such as capital equipment, materials & energy; pollution control, effluent treatment & recycling of waste products or any other areas of research. This is the only scheme in the entire government set-up for benchmarking industrial R&D.
benefits: Eligibility for fiscal incentives for research and development by industry.
Access to funds for R&D from other government departments and agencies.
eligibility: The applicant should be a company registered under the Companies Act, 1956 or 2013.
The company shall be eligible for consideration only after the completion of three financial years after formation.
The applicant should have a regular source of income for at least the last two years to sustain the business.
The companies seeking recognition for their in-house R&D units should be engaged in manufacturing or production or in rendering technical services.
Independent infrastructure for research activities and adequate technically qualified manpower should be available (Minimum area for the R&D activities should be at least 1000 sq. ft.).
At the time of application, the R&D unit(s) should be functional and should have well-defined, time-bound R&D programmes.
content.application_process: Online application through the DSIR website or the Portal. After submission, a cover letter and application form must be sent via email.
documents_required: Complete one e-application signed by the MD/whole-time Director of the company.
A walk-in CD containing a corporate presentation.
Latest annual report of the company.
A note on the R&D activities of the R&D unit(s).
Details of scientific personnel working in the R&D unit(s).

faqs.question: What Is The Objective Of The 'Recognition Of In-House R&D Units' Scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective is to grant recognition & registration to in-house R&D units established by the corporate industry.

faqs.question: What Are Some Examples Of Engagements In The Research For Increased Efficiency In The Use Of Resources?
faqs.answer: Examples include capital equipment, materials & energy; pollution control, effluent treatment & recycling of waste products.

faqs.question: Is A Hard Copy Of The Application Required To Be Sent To DSIR?
faqs.answer: No, companies need not submit the hard copy of the application to DSIR.
